title: Most useless ultimate in game?
body:
What do you guys think the most useless ultimate in game is? (Not including Udyr or Nidalee, because these are kinda just extra abilities.) Thing that come to my mind is Urgot but I can see him using it in lane when ally jg is ganking his lane. Then I also thought about Rek sai. Her ultimate is close to useless late game. It provides nothing in late game in a 5v5 fight and even if you have a tunnel behind the enemy to try to kill squishies they probably have destroyed it because they saw it from wards. Hell Urgot can go tank and switch positions with an enemy tank if he is caught out.  I would love to hear the rest of the community's opinions. :)
~UPDATE- Corki doesn't count as it is basically an extra ability and not an ult.

{{champion:20}} 

A circle ult that *COULD* do a ton of damage.  In reality it usually does less damage than {{champion:33}}' Tremors.

Nunu has to A) get into the enemy team, B) Channel his ult, C) Hope he doesn't get CCed, D) Hope his enemies have 0 mobility, E) Pray they don't have flash.

See: {{champion:85}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:9}} for some actually useful variations.

It ranges from useless to "this is a decent slow" while your allies kill them.

{{champion:266}} is pretty close but at least he can use it to finish people off at decent range.

My opinion on Nunu is that because of his kit his ult actually isn't that bad. His ult would be pretty garbage on the majority of champions, but since his teamfight presence extends approximately as far as 'give ADC attack speed' without it it's just a good enough ability to use in a fight. It debuffs the enemy team quite effectively in an AOE, which is OK for Nunu because he already gives his carry so much gold in AS, meaning stripping the enemy team of MS and AS is quite good.

I actually think Absolute Zero is marginally stronger than The Box. They're both similar abilities in their end goal (clog a chock of cut the enemy team) but I think Nunu's is stronger due to the threat it presents and AS debuff. Nunu's ult is good because it forces the enemy team to waste CC on a champ who is basically worthless once he's hit his W anyway.

For a few different reasons I think these are pretty underwhelming.

Anivia wall is really powerful though, and Anivia wall doesn't let you roam. Most other global/semi-global repositioning ults do basically the same thing; provide some utility in addition to the reposition (TF gives global vision, TK lets you take another person, Panth's does a lot of damage, Nocturne has vision denial, Shen gives a massive shield, Sion's ult is arguably a semi-global and it does a lot of damage and CC). All those ults have some sort of global warning. Taliyah's ult might not be the most powerful in the game, but it's far from the most useless.

Pretty much every ultimate is good, those that appear weak at first glance like those of {{champion:121}} {{champion:223}} tend to carry multiple effects that make their ultimate much stronger looking at all the pieces they offer. The active of Kha'Zix's ultimate is garbage, but his ultimate also upgrades his QWE or R into a much better skill.
----------

Aatrox is just odd in that his passive is amazingly strong rather than lackluster, and his ultimate is lackluster instead of a amazingly strong.
It's also hard to imagine any champion being improved from gaining Aatrox's ultimate over their existing ultimate. 
60% AS and 50 range for 12 seconds is much more QWE in terms of power, even with the 200/300/400 damage melee-range AoE nuke. As an AD champion quite capable of reaching 400 damage auto-attacks, the AP scaling on Massacre also makes the skill pretty "eh", especially with it's extremely lengthy CD relative to the skill's overall power.
